item.title: True Pi vs. Foo Pi
item.description: For some years now, I have been hearing that Pi ( Ï€ ) value in our textbooks is neither right nor correct. There has been some anecdotal evidence from people manufacturing cylinders of larger diameter, saying that measured circumference is not the same as calculated one. How did this error of Pi happen, how did it persist for over 2000 years, and still is in our textbooks today ?
